FOUND IN: The most renowned Dalai Lama was XIVth (Tenzin Gyatso), who served as both the chief priest and de facto ruler of Tibet before his political power was transferred following the 1959 uprising against Chinese occupation, leading to him becoming a symbolic figurehead for many Tibetans.
